article.headline: Davidson 64, Appalachian St. 63
article.story: BOONE, N.C. (AP) -- Brendan Winters and Logan Kosmalski each scored 14 points to lead Davidson past Appalachian State 64-63 on Tuesday night. Kosmalski also had a game-high 15 rebounds for the Wildcats (15-11, 10-5 Southern Conference), including a tip-in at the buzzer to get his team the win. Davidson outrebounded the Mountaineers 37-28 but also committed 20 turnovers. Noah Brown led Appalachian State (9-19, 4-11) with 16 points. Derek Thomas and Chris McFarland had 10 points apiece. Davidson led 32-25 at halftime as the Mountaineers shot 28 percent from the field in the first half. Appalachian State made 7-of-12 3-pointers in the second half to battle back. The Wildcats made 14-of-16 free throws and shot 45 percent from the field. They've won seven straight games.
